title: Waterfall
alt: Blue waterfall painting with cherry blossom tree in the foreground.
canvas: The drawing notebooks we used to have in school.
funFact: This painting taught me my first major lessons in art: You can never have enough white paint.

title: Green Landscape
canvas: The drawing notebooks we used to have in school.
funFact: It was really hard to put so many layers of paint and the paper started to peel at some point too. Bob Ross paints on a canvas with Oil Paint so this painting just does not have as much dimensions as his.

title: Sculpted Face
funFact: I don't know how to categorize this face because honestly this could be a really pretty guy or a very handsome woman.

title: Looking at the Sky
funFact: Someone pointed out that this painting looks quite like me. I agree that we share similar face shape.
quote: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." - Oscar Wilde

title: Gryffindore Lion
funFact: The 'G' on lower right corner is supposed to be for Gryffindore. Can you guess which Hogwarts House I belong to? I am a proud Hufflepuff.

title: Wizard Spider-Man
funFact: I drew this just before Spider-Man: No Way Home was announced. Also Spider-Man and Doctor Strange have a good dynamic in the Disney-XD Ultimate Spider-Man. In one of the episodes we can even see Spider-Man wearing the cape of Doctor Strange.
show: Ultimate Spider-Man (I think the episodes of most Disney XD shows are being streamed 24 hours on Youtube now!)

title: Harry Potter
medium: Oil Pastels (The tiny ones that come in a pack of 10.)
canvas: The drawing notebooks we used to have in school.
funFact: I did not get a smartphone till 2020. I drew this by looking at the reference image on a Jio-phone screen. Also the blended oil pastel backgrounds were quite a hit at the time.

title: Girl with a story
funFact: So this is obviously multiple drawings put into one. I was going for the sketch book pages type of designs on pinterest. My roommates tried to build a story about the girl based on the elements for fun. Turns out she had a sad ending.

kdrama.text: Revenge Note (The protagonist looks very similar to her.)

title: Eyes
alt: Bue penn sketch of two eyes and nose on white sheet of paper
funFact: The eyes look a lot like the eyes of TimothÃ©e Chalamet. Honestly all pretty drawings of eyes on Pinterest look like him. He just has those eyes.
book: Call me by Your Name (I read it around the same time as I drew this.)

blog.text: I wrote a blog post about it!

title: All Consuming
quote:
I can think of so many Friedrich Nietzsche quotes that would be appropriate for this painting, but let's go with these:
"I know of no better life purpose than to perish in attempting the great and the impossible."

title: Baby Turtle
canvas: The drawing notebooks we used to have in school.

title: Thriving Plant
original: Quote I think from Instagram and drawing from Pinterest.

title: Glitch in the Matrix kind of Girl
Man on a Mountain

Giraffe
canvas: The drawing notebooks we used to have in school.

title: One More Chapter
funFact: My very religious mother saw this painting on my wall during a video call. I was immediately instructed to remove such devious paintings and put paintings of Goddess Saraswati.

title: Cat sitting beside a Flower Vase
Faces in the Stary Night
funFact: I was listening to songs one night and 'Say You Won't Let Go' came on. I had this sudden urge to make something really beautiful. So I painted this while the song played on loop for 3 hours.

song.text: Say You Won't Let Go by James Arthur

title: Smoking Man
funFact: I think this guy just gives off that morally grey character vibe. It is not a coincidence that he reminds me so much of 'Luc' from 'The Invisible Life of Addie LaRue by V.E. Schwab'.

book.text: The Invisible Life of Addie LaRue by V.E. Schwab

title: Ballet Women
funFact: She just looks so graceful and at peace. In my minds eye she is a Ballet performer doing elaborate swan like poses.

alt: A vulture eating a man in shackles, who has only little skin left on his bones, as light fall on them.
title: Vulture and Man in Shackels
